Package fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.artemtolpa.util

Class Arrays

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.artemtolpa.util.Arrays
public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object
The class Arrays contains methods that convert String array to int array, check if the given value is in the array and check if two arrays have the same values.
Author:
Artem Tolpa

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Arrays()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static boolean contains​(int value, int[] array)
    The contains method checks if the given value is in the array.
    static int containsSameValues​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
    The containsSameValues method compares two arrays, checking if they have the same values.
    static java.lang.String[] prefix​(int[] array)
    The prefix method adds a prefix "0" to the elements of the array.

    The print method method prints the elements of the array.

    The sort method sorts the array in ascending order.

  • Constructor Details

    • Arrays

      public Arrays()

  • Method Details

    • toIntArray

      public static int[] toIntArray​(java.lang.String[] array)
      The toIntArray method transforms String array elements into numbers using the parseInt method.
      Parameters:
      array - the String array that contains numbers as text
      Returns:
      int array obtained after transformation

    • contains

      public static boolean contains​(int value, int[] array)
      The contains method checks if the given value is in the array.

      If the value is found, then the method returns true, else returns false. A linear search algorithm is used to find the value.

      Parameters:
      value - the given value to look for in the array.
      array - array to search.
      Returns:
      true if the value was found, false if the value was not found.

    • containsSameValues

      public static int containsSameValues​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
      The containsSameValues method compares two arrays, checking if they have the same values.

      The method uses a nested for loop to compare arrays. The method contains a counter that increments its value every time the same values are found in the arrays.

      Parameters:
      array1 - first array to compare.
      array2 - second array to compare.
      Returns:
      number of same values.

    • sort

      public static int[] sort​(int[] numbers)
      The sort method sorts the array in ascending order. Selective sort is used as a sorting algorithm.
      Parameters:
      numbers - the array to be sorted.
      Returns:
      sorted array.

    • print

      public static void print​(java.lang.String description, java.lang.String[] array)
      The print method method prints the elements of the array.
      Parameters:
      description - description of array you want to print. For example: "User Lotto", "Random Lotto", etc.
      array - the array whose elements you want to print.

    • prefix

      public static java.lang.String[] prefix​(int[] array)
      The prefix method adds a prefix "0" to the elements of the array.
      Parameters:
      array - the given array, to the elements of which you want to add a prefix.
      Returns:
      ready array with prefixes.
